author: Mario Naccarato

text:
Oh my fucking god. I was sitting here at my computer when this song hit me like a truck. I have no idea why I started humming it in my head. For about 2 hours I rattled my brain thinking where the hell I know this song from. It was agonizing. I've had songs stuck in my head before, but this was much different. I kept narrowing it down to a song I know for a fact I heard on an older system, SNES especially. I remember odd sounds that accompanied it as I hummed the music and I couldn't figure out what they were. (Now I know it was when Mario falls off the back of Yoshi and makes crying sounds along with the sharp pitch, alerting that he is in danger.)

At first I thought it was Spot goes to Hollywood, I searched but nothing came up that matched. For some reason I thought it was a boat level where the music originated. Then I thought Super Mario brothers 3, Boo's mansion. Once I heard it I remembered what boo's mansion sounded like. For a split second I though it may have been Yoshi's Island, but dismissed it. About half an hour later, no idea why, but I had a strong feeling it was Yoshi's Island. Went to Google, searched Yoshi's Island soundtracks and eventually got here.

Jesus, the feeling of finding the source felt like an elephant was lifted off of me. I rarely ever let things like this bug me; I usually just brush it off and forget, but for some reason this persisted. Glad I pursued, now I fee like playing this again. No idea why I felt like typing all this.

TL;DR This song got stuck in my head, spent 2 hours trying to figure out were I know it from. Quite the journey.
author: Dyyro

text: LOL! Â I can't stand it when a song is stuck in my head and I can't for the life of me figure out what it is.

author: Expunge6667

text: @nightbane2 Exactly. Crap has always existed in all forms of media. People just tend to remember the good stuff and forget the bad, leading them to unfairly compare the best of the past to the worst of the present. For example, some people insist that all music from the 60's was awesome and that Justin Beiber grade crap didn't exist back then, but "Sugar, Sugar", a song by "The Archies" was the number one single of 1969.
